original: A list of top frequently asked Ruby on Rails interview questions and answers are given below.
result: Here is a compilation of commonly asked Ruby on Rails interview questions along with their respective answers.

original: Ruby on Rails is a server-side web application development framework written in Ruby language. It allows you to write less code than other languages and frameworks. It includes everything needed to create database-backed web applications according to MVC pattern.
result: Ruby on Rails is a web application development framework that leverages the Ruby programming language. It is a server-side technology that enables developers to create advanced web applications while writing less code than other frameworks. With Ruby on Rails, one can easily build database-backed apps utilizing the Model, View, and Controller (MVC) architectural pattern.

result: To obtain additional details, follow this link.

original: DRY stands for Don't Repeat Yourself. It is a principle of software development which states that "Every piece of knowledge must have an authoritative, unambiguous, single representation within a system. If the same part of the code will not repeat again and again, the code will be more maintainable, extensible and less buggy.
result: DRY is a principle followed in software development to reduce repetition of code. It emphasizes the need for every piece of knowledge to be represented in a single, clear way within the system. This leads to more maintainable and less buggy code that is easier to extend in the future.

original: For more information:  Click here
result: To access additional details, visit this link.

original: Rails 5.0.1 was released on December 21, 2016. It introduced Action cable, Turbolinks 5 and API mode.
result: On December 21, 2016, a new version of Rails, version 5.0.1, was released. The update introduced several new features, including API mode, Turbolinks 5, and Action Cable.

original: DRY stands for Convention over Configuration. It provides different opinions on the best way to do many things in a web application.
result: DRY is an acronym that stands for a programming principle known as "Don't Repeat Yourself." This principle emphasizes the need to avoid duplication of effort when developing software applications. It recommends using standard practices and conventions to streamline the development process, rather than configuring everything manually. Additionally, the DRY principle advocates for clean and concise code that is easy to understand and maintain.

original: The super function in Ruby is used to invoke the original method. It calls the superclass implementation of the current method.
result: The role of the super function in Ruby is to execute the original method. It utilizes the superclass implementation of the current method to carry out its function.

original: A perfect ORM hides the details of a database's relational data behind the object hierarchy. In Rails, ORM is implemented by Active Record which is one of the most critical components of the Rails library.
result: An optimal ORM is designed to conceal the intricacies of a database's relational data by utilizing an object hierarchy. Within the Rails framework, ORM is facilitated by a significant component known as Active Record.

original: While using Active Record, you have to no longer deal with database constructs like tables, rows or columns. Your application only deals with classes, attributes, and objects.
result: Active Record is a tool that allows developers to interact with databases in an object-oriented manner. Instead of having to work with traditional database constructs like tables, rows, and columns, developers can use classes, attributes, and objects to manipulate data. This abstraction makes it easier to build and maintain applications, as developers can focus on the application logic rather than database management.

result: You can find further details by clicking on the provided link.

original: Active Record is based on a design pattern created by Martin Fowler. From this design pattern only, the Active Record got its name. Its code works very well even with less number of lines. It is quite easy to use. Active Record Rails application does not need any configuration at all if proper naming schemes are followed in your database and classes.
result: Active Record is a software design pattern created by Martin Fowler, from which the Active Record name is derived. This pattern facilitates solid code functionality with shorter code lengths. Its user-friendliness makes it easy to use. Active Record Rails applications require minimal configurations if proper naming conventions are used for databases and classes.

original: The Rails router recognizes URLs and dispatches them to a controller's action. It also generates paths and URLs. Rails router deals with URLs differently from other language routers. It determines controller, parameters, and action for the request.
result: The Rails router has the important function of identifying and directing URLs to the appropriate controller's action. It also has the ability to create paths and URLs. What distinguishes Rails router from routers used in other programming languages is the way it handles URLs. It is responsible for identifying the relevant controller, parameters and action for each request.

original: Main purpose of Rails routers is:
result: The main function of Rails routers is to route HTTP requests to their respective controllers and actions within a Rails application.

Utilizing this feature allows for more flexible and efficient web development.

original: The yield statement in Rails decides where to render the content for the action in the layout. If there is no yield statement in the layout, the layout file itself will be rendered, but additional content into the action templates will not be correctly placed within the layout.
result: In the context of Rails, the function of the yield statement is to determine the location for rendering the content of a particular action within the layout. If the layout file lacks a yield statement, then the layout file will be rendered, but any extra content in the action templates will not be properly incorporated into the layout file.

original: Rails validation defines valid states for each of your Active Record model classes. They are used to ensure that only valid details are entered into your database.
result: Rails validation is a crucial aspect of your Active Record model classes as it determines what constitutes as valid data for your database. This ensures that only appropriate information is stored and avoids any potential issues or errors.

original: For more information:  Click here
result: To obtain further details, follow this link.

original: The  valid?  triggers your validations and returns true if no errors are found otherwise, false.
result: When you call the `valid?` method, any validations that you've defined for your model are executed. If there are no errors found during the validation process, `valid?` returns true. However, if any errors are found, the method returns false.

original: The  invalid?  is simply the reverse of valid?. It triggers your validations and returns true if invalid otherwise, false.
result: The method 'invalid?' is the opposite of 'valid?'. Its purpose is to activate the validations on a model and return true if errors are found, otherwise it returns false.

result: The technique of "Unobtrusive JavaScript" is widely regarded as one of the most effective methods among frontend developers.

original: Passing symbols opens the possibility of several attacks in your system. The symbol garbage collector collects the symbols which prevent your system from several attacks.
result: Allowing symbols to enter your system can leave it vulnerable to various types of attacks. On the other hand, the symbol garbage collector can effectively remove these symbols and protect your system from such attacks.

original: It is a framework which is used to extend Rails via WebSockets to add some functionality. It integrates WebSockets with the rest of the Rails application very smoothly. It allows you to add some real-time features to your app quickly.
result: Action Cable is a powerful tool for enhancing Rails applications with WebSocket functionality. With its seamless integration into the Rails framework, it's easy to add real-time features to your application. This allows for quick and efficient communication between the server and client, making it an ideal choice for modern web applications.

original: TextMate :The TextMate is mainly used for the Mac operating system. It allows you to write extensions to the base environment. The extensions plug into TextMate to add new features to the base editor. These extensions are called Bundles.
result: TextMate is a text editor that is specifically designed for the Mac operating system. It offers an extension environment where users can create add-ons that enhance the editor's base functionality. These extensions are known as Bundles and can be easily integrated into the TextMate editor to provide more features and capabilities.

original: E :The E-text editor is built just like TextMate editor to work on Windows. It replicates many features of the TextMate and even allows to use the TextMate bundles.
result: The E-text editor is designed for Windows and shares many similarities with the TextMate editor. It offers comparable functionality to TextMate, including the ability to apply TextMate bundles.

original: IntelliJ IDEA :The IntelliJ IDEA is a commercial IDE made of JetBrains. Earlier, it was also used for Java development. JetBrains version 7.0 has added Rails support to the IntelliJ IDEA.
result: The IntelliJ IDEA is a proprietary integrated development environment created by JetBrains. Primarily designed for Java development, version 7.0 added support for Ruby on Rails.

original: NetBeans :The NetBeans is an IDE from Sun. Earlier, it was used for Java development. Sun version 7.0 has added Rails support to the NetBeans.
result: NetBeans is an Integrated Development Environment (IDE) that was originally created by Sun for Java development. The latest version, 7.0, features added support for Rails, making it a versatile platform for web application development.

original: Eclipse :The Eclipse IDE is the most commonly used IDE today. Using a plug-in RadRails, you can add Rails support entirely to the Eclipse environment.
result: Eclipse is a popular Integrated Development Environment (IDE) used widely. It allows integrating Rails support to its environment completely with the help of RadRails plugin.

original: Heroku :The Heroku IDE provides a new and unique way of writing Rails application. It is used entirely online to develop applications. You do not need to install any software on your system to use Heroku. It does not support Internet Explorer.
result: The Heroku platform offers a novel approach to creating Rails applications. Unlike traditional development methods that require software installation on your computer, Heroku's IDE enables you to build applications entirely online. However, it should be noted that the platform is not compatible with Internet Explorer.

original: Aptana Studio :A product from Aptana is a stand-alone desktop IDE based on Eclipse project. It is quite similar to Eclipse. The Rails features are packaged as a plug-in to the Aptana Studio environment.
result: Aptana Studio is a desktop IDE built on Eclipse project that operates as a standalone software. Although quite similar to Eclipse, it is a product of Aptana. The Rails functionality is included in the Aptana Studio environment as a plug-in.

original: RubyMine :The RubyMine IDE is a preferable choice for Rubyists. It provides many extra features than other IDEs. One feature it includes clicks and follows. When you click on a function, it will take you to the function being called. This feature comes in handy when multiple functions share the same name and reside in different files and folder. The other features are Git annotate and Git compare.
result: The RubyMine IDE is a popular choice among developers who work with Ruby. It's known for its extensive range of features that sets it apart from other IDEs. One notable feature that it offers is the click-and-follow option, which allows users to easily navigate through different functions. Additionally, RubyMine includes Git annotate and Git compare features that enhance its functionality. These features are especially helpful when multiple functions share the same name but are located in different files/locations.

original: The Rails console is a command line utility which runs Rails application from the command line. The Rails console is an extension of Ruby IRB. It provides all the features of IRB along with the ability to auto-load Rails application environment, including all its classes and components. It helps you to walk through your application step-by-step.
result: The Rails console is a useful tool for working with a Rails application from the command line. It is an extension of Ruby's IRB console, providing all of the functionality of IRB with the added ability to load the Rails application environment, including all of its components and classes. This allows for easy navigation and debugging of the application, providing a step-by-step approach to working with it.

original: The rails include code generator scripts, which are used to generate model and controller classes for an application automatically. Code generation increases your productivity when developing web applications. By running generator command, skeleton files for all your model and controller classes will be generated. It also generates database migration files for each model it generates.
result: Rails encompasses a set of scripts that enable developers to generate model and controller classes for their applications efficiently. These scripts automate the process of building skeleton files, eliminating the need for manual coding and speeding up the development time. With the generator command, developers can quickly create all the required classes and database migration files in one go, streamlining the development workflow.

original: Rails are configured to use WEBrick server automatically. This server is written in pure Ruby and supports almost all platforms like Windows, Mac or Unix. Alternatively, if you have Mongrel or Lighttpd server installed in your system, Rails uses either of those servers.
result: By default, Rails is set up to utilize the WEBrick server, which is programmed in pure Ruby and is compatible with a variety of operating systems like Mac, Windows, and Unix. However, if you have either the Mongrel or Lighttpd server installed on your device, Rails will use them instead.

original: All the three Rails servers feature automatic reloading of code. It means, when you change your source code, you do not need to restart the server.
result: All three Rails servers come equipped with the capability of automatically reloading your code. This allows you to make changes to your source code without having to restart the server.
